Description: Ear-ring made of jasper and 17 beads and several fragments in different shapes. A: Penannular ear-ring made of jasper, half of it preserved, one finished end preserved. The outer edge shows notches, no incised lines. The outer surface is well polished, the inner surface shows marks from the drill. B: Fragment of a spacer-bead made of turquoise faience, one segment partially preserved, quite cylindrical. C: Two barrel-shaped beads, one made of white faience, the smaller one made of reddish faience. D: Two flattened spherical beads, one much larger than the other, both made of white faience. E: Two ring-shaped beads, made of white faience. F: Two segmented cylindrical beads and several fragments, each complete with three segments, made of white faience. G: 8 disc-shaped beads and several fragments, 7 made of white faience, one in turquoise faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
